name: id
desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

name: dim
desc:
Dimension index of coordinate axis.


For example, [series-parallel.data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-parallel.data) is the following data:

```javascript
[
[1,  55,  9,   56,  0.46,  18,  6,  'good'],
[2,  25,  11,  21,  0.65,  34,  9,  'excellent'],
[3,  56,  7,   63,  0.3,   14,  5,  'good'],
[4,  33,  7,   29,  0.33,  16,  6,  'excellent'],
{ // Data item can also be an Object, so that perticular settings of its line can be set here.
value: [5,  42,  24,  44,  0.76,  40,  16, 'excellent']
lineStyle: {...},
}
...
]
```
In data above, each row is a "data item", and each column represents a "dimension". For example, the meanings of columns above are: "data", "AQI", "PM2.5", "PM10", "carbon monoxide level", "nitrogen dioxide level", and "sulfur dioxide level".






`dim` defines which dimension (which *row*) of data would map to this axis.

Started from `0`. For example, if the `dim` of coordinate axis is `1`, it indicates that the second row of data would map to this axis.

name: parallelIndex
desc:
It is used to define which *coordinate* the *axis* should map to.

For example:

```javascript
myChart.setOption({
parallel: [
{...},                      // the first parallel coordinate
{...}                       // the second parallel coordinate
],
parallelAxis: [
{parallelIndex: 1, ...},    // the first coordinate axis, mapping to the second parallel coordinate
{parallelIndex: 0, ...},    //  the second coordinate axis, mapping to the first parallel coordinate
{parallelIndex: 1, ...},    //  the third coordinate axis, mapping to the second parallel coordinate
{parallelIndex: 0, ...}     //  the fourth coordinate axis, mapping to the first parallel coordinate
],
...
});
```

If there is only one parallel coordinate, you don't have to configure it, whose default value is `0`.

name: realtime
desc:
Whether to refresh view when brush-selecting axis. If is set to be `false`, view is updated after brush-selecting action ends.

When data amount is large, it is suggested to set to be `false` to avoid efficiency problems.

name: areaSelectStyle
desc: Area selecting is available on axes. Here is some configurations.

children.name: width
children.desc: Width of selecting box.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: Border width of the select box.

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: Border color of the select box.

children.name: color
children.desc: Border fill color of the select box.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the select box.

name: type
desc:
Type of axis.

Option:
+ `'value'`
Numerical axis, suitable for continuous data.

+ `'category'`
Category axis, suitable for discrete category data. Category data can be auto retrieved from [series.data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series.data) or [dataset.source](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#dataset.source), or can be specified via [parallelAxis.data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.data).

+ `'time'`
Time axis, suitable for continuous time series data. As compared to value axis, it has a better formatting for time and a different tick calculation method. For example, it decides to use month, week, day or hour for tick based on the range of span.

+ `'log'`
Log axis, suitable for log data.

name: name
desc: Name of axis.

name: nameLocation
desc:
Location of axis name.

**Options: **
+ `'start'`
+ `'middle'` or `'center'`
+ `'end'`

name: nameTextStyle
desc:
Text style of axis name.





### color(Color)="#fff"

axis name text color.





### fontStyle(string)='normal'

axis name font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

axis name font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

axis name font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

### fontSize(number)=12

axis name font size.



### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

<!-- Overwrite color -->

children.name: color
children.desc: Color of axis name uses [axisLine.lineStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.axisLine.lineStyle.color) by default.

name: nameGap
desc: Gap between axis name and axis line.

name: nameRotate
desc: Rotation of axis name.

name: inverse
desc:
Set this to `true` to invert the axis.
This is a new option available from Echarts 3 and newer.

name: boundaryGap
desc:
The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis. The setting and behavior of category axes and non-category axes are different.

The `boundaryGap` of category axis can be set to either `true` or `false`. Default value is set to be `true`, in which case [axisTick](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.axisTick) is served only as a separation line, and labels and data appear only in the center part of two [axis ticks](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.axisTick), which is called *band*.

For non-category axis, including time, numerical value, and log axes, `boundaryGap` is an array of two values, representing the spanning range between minimum and maximum value. The value can be set in numeric value or relative percentage, which becomes invalid after setting [min](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.min) and [max](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.max).
**Example: **
```js
boundaryGap: ['20%', '20%']
```

name: min
desc:
The minimun value of axis.

It can be set to a special value `'dataMin'` so that the minimum value on this axis is set to be the minimum label.

It will be automatically computed to make sure axis tick is equally distributed when not set.

In category axis, it can also be set as the ordinal number. For example, if a catergory axis has `data: ['categoryA', 'categoryB', 'categoryC']`, and the ordinal `2` represents `'categoryC'`. Moreover, it can be set as negative number, like `-3`.

If `min` is specified as a function, it should return a min value, like:
```js
min: function (value) {
return value.min - 20;
}
```

`value` is an object, containing the `min` value and `max` value of the data. This function should return the min value of axis, or return `null`/`undefined` to make echarts use the auto calculated min value (`null`/`undefined` return is only supported since `v4.8.0`).

name: max
desc:
The maximum value of axis.

It can be set to a special value `'dataMax'` so that the minimum value on this axis is set to be the maximum label.

It will be automatically computed to make sure axis tick is equally distributed when not set.

In category axis, it can also be set as the ordinal number. For example, if a catergory axis has `data: ['categoryA', 'categoryB', 'categoryC']`, and the ordinal `2` represents `'categoryC'`. Moreover, it can be set as negative number, like `-3`.

If `max` is specified as a function, it should return a max value, like:
```js
max: function (value) {
return value.max - 20;
}
```

`value` is an object, containing the `min` value and `max` value of the data. This function should return the max value of axis, or return `null`/`undefined` to make echarts use the auto calculated max value (`null`/`undefined` return is only supported since `v4.8.0`).

name: scale
desc:
It is available only in numerical axis, i.e., [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.type): 'value'.

It specifies whether not to contain zero position of axis compulsively. When it is set to be `true`, the axis may not contain zero position, which is useful in the scatter chart for both value axes.

This configuration item is unavailable when the [min](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.min) and [max](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.max) are set.

name: splitNumber
desc:
Number of segments that the axis is split into. Note that this number serves only as a recommendation, and the true segments may be adjusted based on readability.

This is unavailable for category axis.

name: minInterval
desc:
Minimum gap between split lines.

For example, it can be set to be `1` to make sure axis label is show as integer.

```js
{
minInterval: 1
}
```

It is available only for axis of [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.type) 'value' or 'time'.

name: maxInterval
desc:
Maximum gap between split lines.

For example, in time axis ([type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.type) is 'time'), it can be set to be `3600 * 24 * 1000` to make sure that the gap between axis labels is less than or equal to one day.

```js
{
maxInterval: 3600 * 1000 * 24
}
```

It is available only for axis of [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.type) 'value' or 'time'.

name: interval
desc:
Compulsively set segmentation interval for axis.

As [splitNumber](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.splitNumber) is a recommendation value, the calculated tick may not be the same as expected. In this case, interval should be used along with [min](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.min) and [max](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.max) to compulsively set tickings. But in most cases, we do not suggest using this, out automatic calculation is enough for most situations.

This is unavailable for category axis. Timestamp should be passed for [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.type): 'time' axis. Logged value should be passed for [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.type): 'log' axis.

name: logBase
desc: Base of logarithm, which is valid only for numeric axes with [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.type): 'log'.

name: silent
desc: Set this to `true`, to prevent interaction with the axis.

name: triggerEvent
axisLine
desc: Settings related to axis line.

children.name: show
children.desc: Set this to `false` to prevent the axis line from showing.

children.name: symbol
children.desc: Symbol of the two ends of the axis. It could be a string, representing the same symbol for two ends; or an array with two string elements, representing the two ends separately. It's set to be `'none'` by default, meaning no arrow for either end. If it is set to be `'arrow'`, there shall be two arrows. If there should only one arrow at the end, it should set to be `['none', 'arrow']`.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: Size of the arrows at two ends. The first is the width perpendicular to the axis, the next is the width parallel to the axis.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc: Arrow offset of axis. If is array, the first number is the offset of the arrow at the beginning, and the second number is the offset of the arrow at the end. If is number, it means the arrows have the same offset.

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc:
#### color(Color)= '#333'

line styleLine color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: line style line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line style line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

name: axisTick
desc: Settings related to axis tick.

children.name: show
children.desc: Set this to `false` to prevent the axis tick from showing.

children.name: alignWithLabel
children.desc:
Align axis tick with label, which is available only when `boundaryGap` is set to be `true` in category axis. See the following picture:

![600xauto](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#axis-align-with-label.png)

children.name: interval
children.desc:
Interval of axisTick, which is available in category axis.  is set to be the same as [axisLabel.interval](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.axisLabel.interval) by default.

It uses a strategy that labels do not overlap by default.

You may set it to be 0 to display all labels compulsively.

If it is set to be 1, it means that labels are shown once after one label. And if it is set to be 2, it means labels are shown once after two labels, and so on.

On the other hand, you can control by callback function, whose format is shown below:
```js
(index:number, value: string) => boolean
```
The first parameter is index of category, and the second parameter is the name of category. The return values decides whether to display label.

children.name: inside
children.desc: Set this to `true` so the axis labels face the `inside` direction.

children.name: length
children.desc: The length of the axis tick.

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc:
#### color(Color)= '#333'

axisTickLine color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: axisTick line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
axisTick line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc:
Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.








<!-- Overwrite color -->

children.name: color
children.desc: Color of axis label is set to be [axisLine.lineStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.axisLine.lineStyle.color) by default.

name: minorTick
desc:
> Since `v4.6.0`



Settings related minor ticks.

Note: `minorTick` is not available in the `category` type axis.

Examples:

1) Using minor ticks in function plotting.
~[600x350](line-function&edit=1&reset=1)

2) Using minor ticks in log axis.
~[600x350](line-log&edit=1&reset=1)

children.name: show
children.desc: If show minor ticks.

children.name: splitNumber
children.desc: Number of interval splited by minor ticks.

children.name: length
children.desc: Length of minor ticks lines。

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc:
#### color(Color)= "#000"

minorTickLine color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: minorTick line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
minorTick line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc:
Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.








<!-- Overwrite color -->

children.name: color
children.desc: Style configuration of minor ticks lines [axisLine.lineStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#parallelAxis.axisLine.lineStyle.color)。

name: axisLabel
desc: Settings related to axis label.

children.name: show
children.desc: Set this to `false` to prevent the axis label from appearing.

children.name: interval
children.desc:
Interval of Axis label, which is available in category axis.

It uses a strategy that labels do not overlap by default.

You may set it to be 0 to display all labels compulsively.

If it is set to be 1, it means that labels are shown once after one label. And if it is set to be 2, it means labels are shown once after two labels, and so on.

On the other hand, you can control by callback function, whose format is shown below:
```js
(index:number, value: string) => boolean
```
The first parameter is index of category, and the second parameter is the name of category. The return values decides whether to display label.

children.name: inside
children.desc: Set this to `true` so the axis labels face the `inside` direction.

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotation degree of axis label, which is especially useful when there is no enough space for category axis.

Rotation degree is from -90 to 90.

children.name: margin
children.desc: The margin between the axis label and the axis line.

children.name: formatter
showMinLabel
children.desc: Whether to show the label of the min tick. Optional values: `true`, `false`, `null`. It is auto determined by default, that is, if labels are overlapped, the label of the min tick will not be displayed.

children.name: showMaxLabel
children.desc:
Whether to show the label of the max tick. Optional values: `true`, `false`, `null`. It is auto determined by default, that is, if labels are overlapped, the label of the max tick will not be displayed.





### color(Color)='#333'

text color.





### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.
